mental_health_impacts.mechanism: Flavonoids in blueberries enhance neurogenesis and reduce oxidative stress, which may improve mood and cognitive function.
mental_health_impacts.research_context: Human RCTs and cohort studies indicate that regular blueberry consumption is associated with improved mood and reduced depressive symptoms.

mental_health_impacts.mechanism: Antioxidant properties of anthocyanins in blueberries improve blood flow to the brain and enhance synaptic plasticity.
mental_health_impacts.research_context: RCTs show improvements in cognitive performance and memory in older adults consuming blueberry supplements.

mental_health_impacts.mechanism: Polyphenols in blueberries may modulate the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, reducing stress response and anxiety.
mental_health_impacts.research_context: Cohort studies suggest a relationship between polyphenol intake and reduced anxiety symptoms.
